key_title: Key to the species of Thelymitra

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the families in the Asparagales-Liliales complex
Key to the genera of Orchidaceae

source.author: Weber, J.Z.; Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Thelymitra
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Weber, J.Z.; Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Thelymitra. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaf flexuose or spirally twisting; flower usually solitary, deep purple to violet with prominent darker stripes
Leaf straight; flowers 1 to many, variously coloured
Lateral lobes of column absent or without hair-tufts
Lateral lobes of column with hair-tufts
Leaf ovate, less than 4 times as long as wide; flowers greenish-yellow with large reddish-brown blotches
Leaf lanceolate to linear, more than 4 times as long as wide
Lateral lobes of column rudimentary or absent; anther beak oblong, large and protruding; perianth yellow
Lateral lobes of column extended into distinct appendages; anther beak various; perianth various
Lateral lobes of column fleshy, suberect; anther beak obtuse
Lateral lobes of column ribbon-like;  anther beak acute or bifid
Mid-lobe of column absent; lateral lobes of column more than 3 mm long, held above column
Mid-lobe of column prominent; lateral lobes of column less than 3 mm long, protruding forwards
Lateral lobes of column red-brown, smooth; perianth yellow
Lateral lobes of column yellow to pink, crenulate to rugose; perianth usually shades of pink, red or violet
Lateral lobes of column ovoid, with finger-like papillae; perianth bright-pink to deep-violet
Lateral lobes of column oblong-lanceolate, crenulate to rugulose; perianth salmon-pink to reddish
Lateral lobes of column oblong, longer than wide, thickish, slightly toothed on margins; anther-point higher than mid-lobe; sepals not apiculate
Lateral lobes of column quadrangular, not much longer than wide, flattish, with fingerlike papillae outside; anther-point lower than mid-lobe; sepals apiculate
Labellum broadly obovate, different in shape from other perianth segments; lateral lobes of column twisted spirally, obtuse or lobed at apex; anther beak bifid

Labellum obovate to oblanceolate, not greatly different in shape from other perianth segments; lateral lobes of column straight or incurved, not twisted spirally, margins variously erose or toothed; anther beak acute

Lateral lobes of column somewhat concave on inner surface, often strongly incurved throughout, apices usually touching or overlapping;  perianth pale blue (rarely pink) inside, lacking obvious darker striations; moist sandy sites often around the edges of grasstree plains; far East Gippsland

Lateral lobes of column more or less flat, more or less parallel to weakly incurved, apices rarely touching;  perianth deep purplish blue with very strong darker longitudinal striations; mostly alpine and sub-alpine habitats; eastern Victoria
Mid-lobe of column a flap-like or semi-circular appendage or terminated in a variously crested and ornamented ridge
Mid-lobe of column forming a tubular hood over the anther
Perianth bright pink with yellow trichomes on the lateral lobes of column
Perianth usually blue, if rarely pink then trichomes on the lateral lobes of column white
At least the petals with prominent dark spots
Perianth unspotted
Mid-lobe of column deeply and broadly cleft at the tip; apex and margins more or less smooth
Mid-lobe of column narrowly and shallowly cleft at the tip; apex and margins minutely tuberculate
Perianth segments on mature plants usually >15 mm long; flowers often scented, pollinated by native bees (melittophilous)
Perianth segments usually to 10 mm long, rarely reaching 15 mm; flowers usually unscented, generally autogamous and often also cleistogamous
Plants short and stocky, usually clumping; inflorescence rarely exceeding 20 cm and often much shorter; perianth deep blue to purplish with darker striations; grasslands of western Victoria
Plants tall and often slender, rarely clumping; at least some mature plants with the inflorescence exceeding 20 cm tall; perianth pale to dark blue, not obviously striated; various habitats
Perianth segments in mature plants rarely exceeding 18 mm long
Perianth segments in most mature plants exceeding 18 mm long
Inflorescence, basal part of the leaf and bracts often a striking reddish purple in colour; whole plant sometimes glaucous; mallee habitats
Inflorescence, leaf and bracts predominantly green, sometimes with some minor purplish suffusions; plant not glaucous; more mesic habitats
Mid-lobe of column compressed dorsally, distal margin usually with two forward-pointing teeth; montane and subalpine habitats; flowers mostly December to February
Mid-lobe of column barely compressed dorsally, distal margin lacking two forward-pointing teeth; lowland habitats; flowers mostly September to October
Mid-lobe of column covered with a glaucous or glistening bloom
Mid-lobe of column lacking bloom

Mid-lobe of column narrow at the base and widest towards the apex; trichomes on the lateral lobes of column sparse, often connate at the base, 0.05–0.1 mm thick, usually bright yellow, strongly embracing the apex of the mid-lobe

Mid-lobe of column widest near the middle and narrowing only slightly above and below; trichomes on the lateral lobes of column congested, not connate at the base, <0.05 mm thick, white or creamy yellow, not strongly embracing the apex of the mid-lobe
Plants mostly <12 cm tall; flower usually solitary, rarely 2; perianth segments <10 mm long
Plants mostly >12 cm tall; flowers usually 2–6; perianth segments usually >10 mm long

Mid-lobe of column slightly inflated, black with a yellow apex, covered with a thin sparkling bloom, bilobed, the lobes 1.2–1.6 mm long; trichomes on the lateral lobes of column 1–1.2 mm long, usually white, sometimes cream; plants from swampy habitats, often in standing water at anthesis; flowering  mid-November to mid-December

Mid-lobe of column very inflated, mostly pinkish or brown grading into yellow at the apex, covered with a thick, waxy bloom, deeply bilobed, the lobes 1.5–2.5 mm long; trichomes on the lateral lobes of column 1.2–1.6 mm long, usually cream or yellow; plants from dry to moist woodland habitats, rarely in standing water at anthesis; flowering late September to mid-November
Trichomes on the lateral lobes of column usually cream or yellow, proximal trichomes often pinkish, at least basally
Trichomes on the lateral lobes of column usually entirely white, rarely mauve

Mid-lobe of column very inflated, mostly pinkish or brown grading into yellow at the apex, deeply bilobed, the lobes more or less parallel, 1.5–2.5 mm long; plants from dry to moist woodland habitats; flowering late September to mid-November

Mid-lobe of column slightly inflated, mostly dark brown or black with a distinct yellow apex, bilobed, the lobes usually diverging, 0.8–1.5 mm long; plants from moist heathland and swamp margins; flowering early November to early December

Leaf lanceolate (at least on mature plants), usually less than half the height of the inflorescence and often much shorter, blade more or less flat and thin-textured, frequently with dark reddish margins, veins and suffusions; mid-lobe of column often deeply and irregularly slit at the apex into 2 parallel lobes, usually orange-brown or bright reddish orange

Leaf linear to linear-lanceolate, usually fleshy and canaliculate mostly more than half the height of the inflorescence; mid-lobe of column sometimes v-notched but not irregularly slit at the apex, usually brown to black with a yellow tip
Mid-lobe of column not as above; trichomes white
Mid-lobe of column strongly compressed dorsally in the distal half, apical orifice small; trichomes white or mauve
Mid-lobe of column mostly glossy black; trichomes white; sterile bracts usually 2; perianth pale blue
Mid-lobe of column dark reddish brown; trichomes usually pink or mauve, rarely white; sterile bracts usually 3; perianth slaty blue to purplish
Lateral lobes of column glabrous in at least the basal ¼ to ½, with trichomes in a more or less terminal mop-like arrangement
Lateral lobes of column not glabrous at the base, with trichomes extending more or less along their entire length in a toothbrush-like arrangement
Tepals reflexing back strongly towards the ovary, particularly at air temperatures of 30 degrees Celsius or more; mid-lobe of column uniformly dark blackish green or brown throughout
Tepals spreading at about right angles to the ovary, but never reflexing strongly even on the hottest days; mid-lobe of column usually bicolorous
Leaf blade flat; leaf fistula at ground level; column mid-lobe not inflated
Leaf blade at least partly channelled, often fleshy; leaf fistula well above ground level; column mid-lobe inflated
Sterile bract always single; ovary very pale, yellow-green; exterior surface of sepals lilac with pale edges
Sterile bracts usually 2; ovary not very pale, yellow-green, exterior surface of sepals not lilac with pale edges
Flowers usually 1–3, most often pale blue; lateral lobes 0.5–1 mm long, bent sharply upwards at c. 90º near the middle; post-anther lobe entire or emarginate
Flowers usually 4–10, most often mauve or deep purplish blue; lateral lobes 1.2–1.5 mm long, curved gently upwards; post-anther lobe usually deeply bilobed at the apex

Mature flower buds inflated, about 10 mm in diameter, subacute at apex; exterior of sepals pink with darker striations; column mid-lobe orifice widely gaping, thetwo apical halves often compressed; trichomes of lateral lobes often sparse or lacking

leaf usually > 10 mm wide; mature flower buds not
Mature buds inflated, < 8 mm in diameter, acute at apex; exterior of sepals ranging from brown to grey and pale-edged; column mid-lobe orifice hardly gaping, the two apical halves not compressed; trichomes of the lateral lobes dense;
Perianth segments rarely more than 12 mm long; mature plants rather small and slender; flowers rarely more than 8 even on mature plants; plants often forming clumps; mostly from grasslands
Perianth segments often more than 12 mm long; mature plants tall and stout; flowers more than 8 on at least some mature plants; plants not clumping; from various habitats
Leaf very thick, fleshy and brittle, as long as or longer than inflorescence
Leaf moderately fleshy, flexible, shorter than inflorescence
Mid-lobe of column deeply v-notched, black with a yellow apex; perianth white or very pale blue; sterile bract usually solitary; near-coastal habitats
Mid-lobe of column emarginate, brown with a yellow apex; perianth usually blue or purplish; sterile bracts usually 2; various habitats

Lower pedicels often partially decurrent on rachis; sepals mostly green on external surface; base of upper sterile bract often only half encircling the scape; sterile bracts to 15 cm long; fertile bracts to 35 mm long
Pedicels never decurrent on rachis; sepals mostly purplish on external surface; base of upper sterile bract usually scape-encircling; sterile bracts to 8.5 cm long; fertile bracts to 22 mm long
Mid-lobe of column prominent, extending well beyond point of insertion of the lateral lobes
Mid-lobe of column not well-developed or absent
Column with a pair of auxiliary lobes between the lateral lobes and mid-lobe
Column lacking a pair of auxiliary lobes
Plant robust with a large fleshy leaf and several large leaf-like sterile bracts; perianth variously coloured
Plant slender with a small canaliculate leaf and 1 or 2 small non-leafy sterile bracts; perianth azure blue
Trichomes on lateral lobes of column yellow; perianth pink, spotted or unspotted
Trichomes on lateral lobes of column white; perianth usually blue, spotted or unspotted
Perianth unspotted; surface of mid-lobe of column smooth
Perianth usually spotted; surface of mid-lobe of column rough
Perianth with a few darker blue spots at least on the petals
Perianth unspotted
Mid-lobe of column flap-like, lateral margins not or only slightly recurved; perianth segments 15–25 mm long; flowers opening readily
Mid-lobe of column semi-cylindric, lateral margins strongly recurved; perianth segments to 15 mm long; flowers opening tardily
Perianth unspotted
At least the petals with prominent dark spots
Mid-lobe of column with rows of long finger-like glands
Mid-lobe of column absent or smooth or with few short erect calli
Auxiliary lobes of column with deeply and irregularly toothed margins; trichomes on lateral lobes of column usually yellow
Auxiliary lobes of column not as above; trichomes on lateral lobes of column usually white
Perianth segments usually >13 mm long; flowers usually >10; robust plants to 1 m tall, mainly from mountain forests
Perianth segments to 13 mm long; flowers 1-8; slender plants to 55 cm tall, mainly from heathlands and swamp margins
Auxiliary lobes of column often >1 mm long; perianth segments narrow and overlapping only at base, deep blue to purplish or pinkish on inner surface; plants mainly from swamp margins
Auxiliary lobes of column to 1 mm long; perianth segments broad and overlapping for at least half their length, pale blue on inner surface; plants mainly from sandy heathlands

Perianth segments lanceolate, imbricate at base only; sepals greenish; petals purplish with a few large dark purple spots and blotches; fertile bracts often very large, to 50 mm long; flowers often present in Winter

Perianth segments more or less ovate, imbricate; sepals bluish or purplish; petals same colour as sepals and with dark purple spots or blotches; fertile bracts not exceptionally large, usually to 25 mm long; flowers usually present in Spring
Perianth segments usually more than 17 mm long on mature plants; flowers opening freely, insect-pollinated
Perianth segments to 17 mm long on mature plants; flowers opening tardily, self-pollinated
